headline: Pricier iPhones? Global memory chip crunch puts spotlight on Apple
summary: As the global memory chip shortage hits the smartphone market, a key question is echoing from Silicon Valley to Shenzhen: Will Apple raise prices, or sacrifice profit to gain new customers?  CEO Tim Cook told investors he expected memory chip prices to increase ‌sharply, but declined to answer analysts' questions about whether Apple would raise prices in response.  "There are different levers that we can push, and who knows how successful they'll be, but there's just a range ‌of options," Cook said on the post-earnings call.

content.title: Pricier iPhones? Global memory chip crunch puts spotlight on Apple
content.summary: As the global memory chip shortage hits the smartphone market, a key question is echoing from Silicon Valley to Shenzhen: Will Apple raise prices, or sacrifice profit to gain new customers?  CEO Tim Cook told investors he expected memory chip prices to increase ‌sharply, but declined to answer analysts' questions about whether Apple would raise prices in response.  "There are different levers that we can push, and who knows how successful they'll be, but there's just a range ‌of options," Cook said on the post-earnings call.

headline: Apple Just Had The Biggest Quarter In iPhone History
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) reported impressive sales growth in the fourth quarter of 2025, even as overall U.S. smartphone sales increased by only 1% year-over-year (Y/Y). Weak low-end and premium Android sales held back overall growth. Apple’s Record Sales Push Market Share to 69% Apple achieved its best sales quarter, expanding its market share to 69%, while Motorola rose to the #1 spot in the sub-$300 category with its new Moto G 2026 series devices, according to Counterpoint Research. Apple’s

headline: Despite The Ho-Hum Dividend, SCHG Beat the S&P 500 by An Impressive 15%
summary: The Schwab U.S. Large-Cap Growth ETF (NYSEARCA:SCHG) isn’t designed to generate meaningful dividend income. With a yield of just 0.34%, it returns less than a third of what the broader market typically offers. That’s not a flaw. It’s the entire point. This fund exists to capture capital appreciation from America’s fastest-growing large-cap companies, not to ... Despite The Ho-Hum Dividend, SCHG Beat the S&P 500 by An Impressive 15%

headline: AI trade splinters as investors get more selective
summary: The global AI trade is starting to fracture as soaring capex, rising debt loads and doubts over who will profit from the technology force investors to draw sharper lines.  When ChatGPT launched in November 2022, anything linked to the artificial intelligence theme surged - from chipmakers and software firms to raw-materials suppliers ‌and even companies most exposed to AI disruption.  That lifted equity and debt markets to levels that have drawn bubble warnings from regulators and investors, even as the likes of Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet and Meta mapped ‌out hundreds of billions of dollars in spending.

content.title: AI trade splinters as investors get more selective
content.summary: The global AI trade is starting to fracture as soaring capex, rising debt loads and doubts over who will profit from the technology force investors to draw sharper lines.  When ChatGPT launched in November 2022, anything linked to the artificial intelligence theme surged - from chipmakers and software firms to raw-materials suppliers ‌and even companies most exposed to AI disruption.  That lifted equity and debt markets to levels that have drawn bubble warnings from regulators and investors, even as the likes of Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet and Meta mapped ‌out hundreds of billions of dollars in spending.

headline: Ex-PayPal President David Marcus Says 'Defensive' BNPL Strategy Handed PYPL's Market Share To Rivals, Leading To Stagnant Growth
summary: Following a 20% collapse in PayPal Holdings Inc.‘s (NASDAQ:PYPL) stock price and the abrupt removal of CEO Alex Chriss, former company president David Marcus has broken a twelve-year silence to critique a culture of “financial optimization” that he claims has hollowed out the payments pioneer. Legacy Of Optimization Marcus, who led PayPal until 2014 before moving to Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META), attributed the company's current struggles to a long-term shift away from product-led innovation

content.title: Ex-PayPal President David Marcus Says 'Defensive' BNPL Strategy Handed PYPL's Market Share To Rivals, Leading To Stagnant Growth

Legacy Of Optimization Marcus, who led PayPal until 2014 before moving to Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META), attributed the company's current struggles to a long-term shift away from product-led innovation
